改.definition: to change; to alter; to transform; to correct

改元.definition: to change an emperor's or ruler's reign title (old)

改刀.definition: to cut food into a specific size or shape (strips, slices or cubes etc); (dialect) screwdriver

改判.definition: (law) to amend a judgment; to commute; (in a contest or exam) to change the original decision or score

改則.definition: Gerze county in Ngari prefecture, Tibet, Tibetan: Sger rtse rdzong

改則縣.definition: Gerze county in Ngari prefecture, Tibet, Tibetan: Sger rtse rdzong

改動.definition: to alter; to modify; to revise

改口.definition: to change one's tune; to modify one's previous remark; to change the way one addresses sb (as when one marries and starts to call one's husband's parents 爸爸[ba4 ba5] and 媽媽|妈妈[ma1 ma5])

改口費.definition: a gift of money given by parents on both sides after a wedding, to their new daughter-in-law or son-in-law

改善.definition: to make better; to improve; CL:個|个[ge4]

改嘴.definition: to deny; to go back on one's word

改圖.definition: to edit a picture; to modify an image; (literary) to change one's plans

改天.definition: another day; some other time; to find another day (for appointment etc); to take a rain check

改學.definition: to switch from one major or faculty to another (at a university)

改建.definition: to rebuild; to transform (a building); to refurbish

改弦易轍.definition: change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction; to dance to a different tune

改惡向善.definition: turn away from evil and follow virtue

改成.definition: to convert; to turn into (sth else); to adapt (a story to another medium)

改換.definition: to change (sth); to alter (sth); to change over (to sth else)

改換門庭.definition: to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world; to switch one's allegiance to a new patron

改換門閭.definition: see 改換門庭|改换门庭[gai3 huan4 men2 ting2]

改朝.definition: to transition to a new dynasty

改朝換代.definition: to transition to a new dynasty or regime

改期.definition: to reschedule; to rearrange (e.g. a meeting); to postpone

改款.definition: to make modifications to a product's model or design

改正.definition: to correct; to amend; to put right; correction; CL:個|个[ge4]

改版.definition: to revise the current edition; revised edition

改用.definition: to change over to; to switch to; to use (sth different)

改稱.definition: to change a name; to rename

改簽.definition: to change one's reservation; to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train

改編.definition: to adapt; to rearrange; to revise

改良主義.definition: reformism (i.e. favoring gradual change as opposed to revolution)

改裝.definition: to change one's costume; to repackage; to remodel; to refit; to modify; to convert

改觀.definition: change of appearance; to revise one's point of view

改訂伊犁條約.pinyin: Gai3 ding4 Yi1 li2 Tiao2 yue1
改訂伊犁條約.definition: Treaty of Saint Petersburg of 1881 in which Russia agreed to hand back Yili province to Qing China in exchange for compensation payment and unequal treaty rights

改變.definition: to change; to alter; to transform

改造.definition: to transform; to reform; to remodel; to remold

改進.definition: to improve; to make better; improvement; CL:個|个[ge4]

改運.definition: to alter one's fate; to improve one's luck (e.g. by changing one's name or phone number)

改過.definition: to correct one's errors; to mend one's ways

改過自新.definition: to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf

改道.definition: to change route; to divert (a road or a watercourse)

改邪歸正.definition: to mend one's ways (idiom); to turn over a new leaf

改隸.definition: (of an entity) to come under the administration of (a different authority)

改革.definition: reform; CL:次[ci4],種|种[zhong3],項|项[xiang4]; to reform

改革開放.definition: to reform and open to the outside world; refers to Deng Xiaoping's policies from around 1980

改頭換面.definition: to change outwardly while remaining essentially the same (derog.) (idiom); (Tw) (non-derogatory) to change considerably; to undergo a transformation
